com.seamless.ers.client.externalws.dto
Class Amount

java.lang.Object
  com.seamless.ers.client.externalws.dto.Amount
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Amount
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is the standard class used to send amounts to/from the ERS.

All amounts are expressed as a long value and a String currency.
The value is specified in the smallest denominator for the currency (eg. cents for euro) (So for must currencies, this has to be divided by 100 to get the actual amount) The currency is expressed using the ISO-4217 currency code for currency.

Author:
kent
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Amount

public Amount()
Create an empty amount with zero value and null currency. Currency must be set using setCurrency before it can be used.

Amount

public Amount(int unscaledValue,
              int scale,
              java.lang.String currency)
Create an Amount object with an value deducted from an unscaled value and a scale. The scale decides how many decimal places should be applied to the interger according to this formula.

<actual value> = <unscaledVal> * 10 ^ (-<scale>)

Examples below: 

 UnscaledVal    scale    actual value
 -------------------------------------
 100             2       1
 155             2       1.55
 17              1       1.7
 17              0       17
 17             -1       170
Note that this constructor is not GWT-friendly for GWT versions below 2.1.

Parameters:
unscaledValue - Value before applying the scale
scale -
currency - currency of the amount

Amount

public Amount negate()
Negates this amount, ie if it is positive it will become negative and the opposite
